result.execSummary:
The defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 217 days time served.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body Armor or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. jbs

BRANCH 26 FOR BRANCH 35.  Defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case passed:
Case recalled:
Same appearances:

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armour warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 217 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.     
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Judge Rosa is in trial and unable to conduct plea hearing today. Matter to be heard by Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
/witness list, filed by the State.

Attorney Jerome J. Shimek in court, defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests plea date. Jury trial date of 9/30/15 at 9:30 remains on the Court's calendar.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

Defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn and testified: Dr. Mary Kay Luzi Court admits Exhibit #1 into evidence without objection. Court finds defendent is competent to proceed, Court makes record. Court orders proceedings reinstated. Bail of $500 cash to continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Jerome J. Shimek in court, defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs the Court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered proceedings SUSPENDED and defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. 
Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit.  Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 07.

Jury trial is vacated.

Attorney Jerome J. Shimek in court, defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 6.12.15 and for jury trial on 6.24.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 02/20/2015 received and filed. (11 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Jerome Shimek, 910 Elm Grove Road #3, Elm Grove, 53122.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #06CF3907 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Michael Caballero-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Vanoye Sarafino Kelley in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP 
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
